intro: Phyllanthus fuernrohrii, commonly known as the Fuernrohrii spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often waxy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive shape, while the flowers are usually unisexual and arranged in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Phyllanthus fuernrohrii is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
